19  package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.wal;
20  
21  import java.io.DataInput;
22  import java.io.DataOutput;
23  import java.io.IOException;
24  import java.util.ArrayList;
25  import java.util.List;
26  import java.util.NavigableMap;
27  import java.util.TreeMap;
28  
29  import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
30  import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
31  import org.apache.hadoop.classification.InterfaceAudience;
32  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.codec.Codec;
33  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.HeapSize;
34  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Cell;
35  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.KeyValue;
36  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.WALProtos.CompactionDescriptor;
37  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Bytes;
38  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.ClassSize;
39  import org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable;
40  
41  
42  /**
43   * WALEdit: Used in HBase's transaction log (WAL) to represent
44   * the collection of edits (KeyValue objects) corresponding to a
45   * single transaction. The class implements "Writable" interface
46   * for serializing/deserializing a set of KeyValue items.
47   *
48   * Previously, if a transaction contains 3 edits to c1, c2, c3 for a row R,
49   * the HLog would have three log entries as follows:
50   *
51   *    <logseq1-for-edit1>:<KeyValue-for-edit-c1>
52   *    <logseq2-for-edit2>:<KeyValue-for-edit-c2>
53   *    <logseq3-for-edit3>:<KeyValue-for-edit-c3>
54   *
55   * This presents problems because row level atomicity of transactions
56   * was not guaranteed. If we crash after few of the above appends make
57   * it, then recovery will restore a partial transaction.
58   *
59   * In the new world, all the edits for a given transaction are written
60   * out as a single record, for example:
61   *
62   *   <logseq#-for-entire-txn>:<WALEdit-for-entire-txn>
63   *
64   * where, the WALEdit is serialized as:
65   *   <-1, # of edits, <KeyValue>, <KeyValue>, ... >
66   * For example:
67   *   <-1, 3, <Keyvalue-for-edit-c1>, <KeyValue-for-edit-c2>, <KeyValue-for-edit-c3>>
68   *
69   * The -1 marker is just a special way of being backward compatible with
70   * an old HLog which would have contained a single <KeyValue>.
71   *
72   * The deserializer for WALEdit backward compatibly detects if the record
73   * is an old style KeyValue or the new style WALEdit.
74   *
75   */
76  @InterfaceAudience.Private
77  public class WALEdit implements Writable, HeapSize {
78    public static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(WALEdit.class);
79  
80    // TODO: Get rid of this; see HBASE-8457
81    public static final byte [] METAFAMILY = Bytes.toBytes("METAFAMILY");
82    static final byte [] METAROW = Bytes.toBytes("METAROW");
83    static final byte[] COMPLETE_CACHE_FLUSH = Bytes.toBytes("HBASE::CACHEFLUSH");
84    static final byte[] COMPACTION = Bytes.toBytes("HBASE::COMPACTION");
85    private final int VERSION_2 = -1;
86    private final boolean isReplay;
87  
88    private final ArrayList<KeyValue> kvs = new ArrayList<KeyValue>(1);
89  
90    // Only here for legacy writable deserialization
91    @Deprecated
92    private NavigableMap<byte[], Integer> scopes;
93  
94    private CompressionContext compressionContext;
95  
96    public WALEdit() {
97      this(false);
98    }
99  
100   public WALEdit(boolean isReplay) {
101     this.isReplay = isReplay;
102   }
103 
104   /**
105    * @param f
106    * @return True is <code>f</code> is {@link #METAFAMILY}
107    */
108   public static boolean isMetaEditFamily(final byte [] f) {
109     return Bytes.equals(METAFAMILY, f);
110   }
111 
112   /**
113    * @return True when current WALEdit is created by log replay. Replication skips WALEdits from
114    *         replay.
115    */
116   public boolean isReplay() {
117     return this.isReplay;
118   }
119 
120   public void setCompressionContext(final CompressionContext compressionContext) {
121     this.compressionContext = compressionContext;
122   }
123 
124   public WALEdit add(KeyValue kv) {
125     this.kvs.add(kv);
126     return this;
127   }
128 
129   public boolean isEmpty() {
130     return kvs.isEmpty();
131   }
132 
133   public int size() {
134     return kvs.size();
135   }
136 
137   public ArrayList<KeyValue> getKeyValues() {
138     return kvs;
139   }
140 
141   public NavigableMap<byte[], Integer> getAndRemoveScopes() {
142     NavigableMap<byte[], Integer> result = scopes;
143     scopes = null;
144     return result;
145   }
146 
147   public void readFields(DataInput in) throws IOException {
148     kvs.clear();
149     if (scopes != null) {
150       scopes.clear();
151     }
152     int versionOrLength = in.readInt();
153     // TODO: Change version when we protobuf.  Also, change way we serialize KV!  Pb it too.
154     if (versionOrLength == VERSION_2) {
155       // this is new style HLog entry containing multiple KeyValues.
156       int numEdits = in.readInt();
157       for (int idx = 0; idx < numEdits; idx++) {
158         if (compressionContext != null) {
159           this.add(KeyValueCompression.readKV(in, compressionContext));
160         } else {
161           this.add(KeyValue.create(in));
162         }
163       }
164       int numFamilies = in.readInt();
165       if (numFamilies > 0) {
166         if (scopes == null) {
167           scopes = new TreeMap<byte[], Integer>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
168         }
169         for (int i = 0; i < numFamilies; i++) {
170           byte[] fam = Bytes.readByteArray(in);
171           int scope = in.readInt();
172           scopes.put(fam, scope);
173         }
174       }
175     } else {
176       // this is an old style HLog entry. The int that we just
177       // read is actually the length of a single KeyValue
178       this.add(KeyValue.create(versionOrLength, in));
179     }
180   }
181 
182   public void write(DataOutput out) throws IOException {
183     LOG.warn("WALEdit is being serialized to writable - only expected in test code");
184     out.writeInt(VERSION_2);
185     out.writeInt(kvs.size());
186     // We interleave the two lists for code simplicity
187     for (KeyValue kv : kvs) {
188       if (compressionContext != null) {
189         KeyValueCompression.writeKV(out, kv, compressionContext);
190       } else{
191         KeyValue.write(kv, out);
192       }
193     }
194     if (scopes == null) {
195       out.writeInt(0);
196     } else {
197       out.writeInt(scopes.size());
198       for (byte[] key : scopes.keySet()) {
199         Bytes.writeByteArray(out, key);
200         out.writeInt(scopes.get(key));
201       }
202     }
203   }
204 
205   /**
206    * Reads WALEdit from cells.
207    * @param cellDecoder Cell decoder.
208    * @param expectedCount Expected cell count.
209    * @return Number of KVs read.
210    */
211   public int readFromCells(Codec.Decoder cellDecoder, int expectedCount) throws IOException {
212     kvs.clear();
213     kvs.ensureCapacity(expectedCount);
214     while (kvs.size() < expectedCount && cellDecoder.advance()) {
215       Cell cell = cellDecoder.current();
216       if (!(cell instanceof KeyValue)) {
217         throw new IOException("WAL edit only supports KVs as cells");
218       }
219       kvs.add((KeyValue)cell);
220     }
221     return kvs.size();
222   }
223 
224   public long heapSize() {
225     long ret = ClassSize.ARRAYLIST;
226     for (KeyValue kv : kvs) {
227       ret += kv.heapSize();
228     }
229     if (scopes != null) {
230       ret += ClassSize.TREEMAP;
231       ret += ClassSize.align(scopes.size() * ClassSize.MAP_ENTRY);
232       // TODO this isn't quite right, need help here
233     }
234     return ret;
235   }
236 
237   public String toString() {
238     StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
239 
240     sb.append("[#edits: " + kvs.size() + " = <");
241     for (KeyValue kv : kvs) {
242       sb.append(kv.toString());
243       sb.append("; ");
244     }
245     if (scopes != null) {
246       sb.append(" scopes: " + scopes.toString());
247     }
248     sb.append(">]");
249     return sb.toString();
250   }
251 
252   /**
253    * Create a compacion WALEdit
254    * @param c
255    * @return A WALEdit that has <code>c</code> serialized as its value
256    */
257   public static WALEdit createCompaction(final CompactionDescriptor c) {
258     byte [] pbbytes = c.toByteArray();
259     KeyValue kv = new KeyValue(METAROW, METAFAMILY, COMPACTION, System.currentTimeMillis(), pbbytes);
260     return new WALEdit().add(kv); //replication scope null so that this won't be replicated
261   }
262 
263   /**
264    * Deserialized and returns a CompactionDescriptor is the KeyValue contains one.
265    * @param kv the key value
266    * @return deserialized CompactionDescriptor or null.
267    */
268   public static CompactionDescriptor getCompaction(KeyValue kv) throws IOException {
269     if (kv.matchingRow(METAROW) && kv.matchingColumn(METAFAMILY, COMPACTION)) {
270       return CompactionDescriptor.parseFrom(kv.getValue());
271     }
272     return null;
273   }
274 }
